p: However, the research focus on Anopheles as vectors of malaria has led to a relative lack of study about Anopheles viruses. In addition to malaria parasites, Anopheles mosquitoes also harbor viruses, collectively termed the virome. The Anopheles virome is poorly studied, and the number and function of viruses are unknown. Some of them are confirmed arthropod-borne pathogenic viruses (arboviruses), which multiply in the mosquito vector before transmission to a vertebrate host. Others are thought to be insect-specific viruses that may replicate only in the insect host [ 4, 5].
